comment: Very funny and listens to people's perspectives on topics. There are a handful of assignments so make sure to do all. Lectures were not that heavy but mostly classroom discussions. There are 3 plays you have to watch outside of class. There are extra-credit opportunities.

Don't listen to these bad reviews. She is one of the best professors I've ever had and is extremely understanding and also very fun. The class is pretty project based but they're easy and she always tries to explain things that aren't clear. You do have to write a few things but nothing extreme. Overall a great professor and interesting class.

These 1107 kids don't appreciate Amanda like the theatre majors do. She's one of the kindest, most understanding profs at KSU. Of course shows are gonna be mandatory to watch, because it is a theatre course! Don't expect an easy A, but if you are having a bit of difficulty, she's more than willing to work with you. So funny and caring, too <3
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Fine professor, never had any troubles with her personally. Answered emails, usually a day later. Everything was straight-forward and easy from the get go. If you stayed on top of things like buying tickets it was fine. Just pay attention and you'll pass with an A.

Awful professor, I would never take it again. Never answered any emails. Mandatory shows you had to go see that often would sell out. extra credit is only given if the show was professional. lectures often got off-topic. wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
Extremely easy course but she is the worst professor Ive had in 3 years. She does not answer emails, extremely rude to students, is not helpful to students when there is issues.
